
```{r include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = F, #omit messages
                      fig.align = "l" #align figures to left margin
                      )
```

Note that the figures presented in the appendix differ from those presented in the main text to the extent that the thresholds $\theta$ have a different meaning. 
That is, for the round-wise integration model, $\theta$ is not the absolute number of mean comparisons a prospect must win (absolute threshold), but the required difference in the number of wins between prospects (relative threshold).
For the summary integration model, $\theta$ is not the absolute cumulative sum across all sampled outcomes a prospect must reach (absolute threshold), but the differences in these sums between prospects.
